questions.question: What is the title of the book reviewed in Chapter 26?
questions.answer: The title is 'George's Secret Key to the Universe'.

questions.question: Who are the authors of this book?
questions.answer: The authors are Lucy Hawking and Stephen Hawking.

questions.question: What do George's parents believe about science and technology?
questions.answer: They believe that modern inventions of science and technology have caused a lot of damage on the earth.

questions.question: Why does George have to suffer ridicule from his friends?
questions.answer: He suffers ridicule because his house has a ban on TV and computers, and they use candles instead of electricity.

questions.question: What does George's Dad do to help the environment?
questions.answer: He is an environmentalist who uses a bicycle instead of a car and avoids using electricity.

questions.question: Does George agree with his parents' view on computers?
questions.answer: No, George thinks it is possible to save the earth using computers and the internet.

questions.question: Who is Annie?
questions.answer: Annie is George's new friend and next-door neighbour.

questions.question: What is Eric's profession?
questions.answer: Eric is a brilliant scientist.

questions.question: What is 'Cosmos' in the story?
questions.answer: Cosmos is a super-intelligent computer built by Eric.

questions.question: Name three things Cosmos can show you in the universe.
questions.answer: Cosmos can show planets, stars, and black holes (or comets).

questions.question: Who is the illustrator of the book?
questions.answer: The illustrator is Garry Parsons.

questions.question: What does the nasty scientist want from Eric?
questions.answer: The nasty scientist wants to steal Cosmos for his own evil purposes.

questions.question: What makes this book different from other adventure stories?
questions.answer: It contains scientific facts about the universe in addition to an imaginary story.

questions.question: What is Stephen Hawking's contribution to the book?
questions.answer: He has presented the scientific information in the book.

questions.question: What planet do we live on?
questions.answer: We live on planet Earth.

questions.answer: Only vegetarian and home-cooked food is allowed.

questions.question: What does 'jeering' mean?

questions.answer: The 'secret key' refers to the computer Cosmos that opens the universe to George.

questions.question: What are the parents committed to?
questions.answer: They are committed to the cause of saving the planet.

questions.question: What does Cosmos literally open for the characters?
questions.answer: It literally opens windows on the universe.

questions.answer: Planets, stars, comets, and black holes are mentioned.

questions.answer: The reviewer says the scientific information is told in a very simple and easy-to-understand manner.

questions.question: What is an environmentalist?
questions.answer: An environmentalist is someone who works to protect the natural environment.

questions.question: Why don't George's parents buy bread and biscuits?
